Employer Identification No.) 1 Infinite Loop Cupertino, California 95014 (Address of principal executive offices) (Zip Code) (408) 996-1010 (Registrant&#146;s telephone number, including area code) Not applicable (Former name or former address, if changed since last report.) Check the appropriate box below if the Form 8-K filing is intended to simultaneously satisfy the filing obligation of the Registrant under any of the following provisions: &nbsp; &#168; Written communications pursuant to Rule 425 under the Securities Act (17 CFR 230.425) &nbsp; &#168; Soliciting material pursuant to Rule 14a-12 under the Exchange Act (17 CFR 240.14a-12) &nbsp; &#168; Pre-commencement communications pursuant to Rule 14d-2(b) under the Exchange Act (17 CFR 240.14d-2(b)) &nbsp; &#168; Pre-commencement communications pursuant to Rule 13e-4(c) under the Exchange Act (17 CFR 240.13e-4(c)) &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Item&nbsp;5.02 Departure of Directors or Certain Officers; Election of Directors; Appointment of Certain Officers; Compensatory Arrangements of Certain Officers. &nbsp; (e) The Board of Directors of Apple Inc. previously adopted, subject to shareholder approval, an amendment and restatement of Apple&#146;s 2014 Employee Stock Plan (the &#147;2014 Plan&#148;). Apple&#146;s shareholders approved the amended and restated 2014 Plan at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders held on February&nbsp;26, 2016 (the &#147;Annual Meeting&#148;). The amended and restated 2014 Plan, which became effective upon shareholder approval, increased the maximum amount payable as a cash bonus award that may qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code to $30 million per person, per fiscal year. The foregoing brief description is qualified in its entirety by the text of the 2014 Plan, a copy of which is filed as Exhibit 10.1 hereto and incorporated herein by reference. Item&nbsp;5.07 Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders. At the Annual Meeting, Apple&#146;s shareholders voted on the following eight proposals and cast their votes as described below. &nbsp; 1. The individuals listed below were elected at the Annual Meeting to serve as directors of Apple until the next annual meeting of shareholders and until their successors are duly elected and qualified: &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; For &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; Against &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; Abstained &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Vote &nbsp; James Bell &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,083,679,346 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 24,740,974 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 5,663,021 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,559,945,580 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; Tim Cook &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,095,246,110 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 11,472,231 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 7,365,000 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,559,945,580 &nbsp;&nbsp; Al Gore &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,012,555,419 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 93,815,156 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 7,712,766 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,559,945,580 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; Bob Iger &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,082,336,074 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 26,966,576 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 4,780,691 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,559,945,580 &nbsp;&nbsp; Andrea Jung &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 2,909,845,673 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 198,749,767 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 5,487,901 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,559,945,580 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; Art Levinson &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,062,321,116 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 45,447,845 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 6,314,380 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,559,945,580 &nbsp;&nbsp; Ron Sugar &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,072,297,672 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 35,589,720 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 6,195,949 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,559,945,580 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; Sue Wagner &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,100,054,215 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 8,423,480 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 5,605,646 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,559,945,580 &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 2. A management proposal to ratify the appointment of Ernst &amp; Young LLP as Apple&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm for 2016, as described in the proxy materials. An advisory resolution to approve executive compensation, as described in the proxy materials.
